rev.comment: clarified it applied to an old license
rev.diff:
Line 50: Line 50:
Concerns have been raised about the similarity between VP8 and H.264 by a developer of [[x264]], an encoder for the [[H.264]] specification.<ref>{{citation |url=http://www.h-online.com/open/news/item/WebM-applauded-but-doubts-persist-1003849.html |title=WebM applauded but doubts persist |publisher=[[Heinz Heise|The H]] |date=2010-05-20 |first=Dj |last=Walker-Morgan}}</ref> Other researchers point to evidence that On2 made an effort to specifically avoid any MPEG LA patents.<ref>{{citation |url=http://carlodaffara.conecta.it/?p=420 |title=An analysis of WebM and its patent risk |date=2010-05-25 |first=Carlo |last=Daffara |publisher=carlodaffara.conecta.it}}</ref>
Concerns have been raised about the similarity between VP8 and H.264 by a developer of [[x264]], an encoder for the [[H.264]] specification.<ref>{{citation |url=http://www.h-online.com/open/news/item/WebM-applauded-but-doubts-persist-1003849.html |title=WebM applauded but doubts persist |publisher=[[Heinz Heise|The H]] |date=2010-05-20 |first=Dj |last=Walker-Morgan}}</ref> Other researchers point to evidence that On2 made an effort to specifically avoid any MPEG LA patents.<ref>{{citation |url=http://carlodaffara.conecta.it/?p=420 |title=An analysis of WebM and its patent risk |date=2010-05-25 |first=Carlo |last=Daffara |publisher=carlodaffara.conecta.it}}</ref>
â
[[Simon Phipps (programmer)|Simon Phipps]], a board member for the [[Open Source Initiative]], expressed doubts as to whether the WebM license was an [[open-source license]], since it had not been submitted to the OSI for approval.<ref>{{citation |url=http://www.computerworlduk.com/community/blogs/index.cfm?entryid=2973 |title=WebM: Missing The Assurances Open Source Needs? |date=2010-05-24 |publisher=ComputerworldUK |first=Simon |last=Phipps}}</ref> In response, the WebM Project decoupled patents from copyright, offering the code under a standard [[BSD license]] and patents under a separate grant.<ref>{{citation |url=http://webmproject.blogspot.com/2010/06/changes-to-webm-open-source-license.html |title=Changes to the WebM Open Source License |date=2010-06-04 |first=Chris |last=DiBona |publisher=WebM}}</ref> The [[Free Software Foundation]], which maintains the [[Free Software Definition]], has given its endorsement for WebM and VP8<ref name="fsf">{{citation |url=http://www.fsf.org/news/free-software-foundation-statement-on-webm-and-vp8 |title=Free Software Foundation statement on WebM and VP8 |date=2010-05-19 |publisher=Free Software Foundation |first=Matt |last=Lee}}</ref> and considers the software's license to be compatible with the [[GNU General Public License]].<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.fsf.org/blogs/licensing/googles-updated-webm-license |title=Google's updated WebM license |publisher=Free Software Foundation|first=Brett |last=Smith |accessdate=2010-06-14}}</ref>
+
[[Simon Phipps (programmer)|Simon Phipps]], a board member for the [[Open Source Initiative]], expressed doubts as to whether the (now replaced) WebM license was an [[open-source license]], since it had not been submitted to the OSI for approval.<ref>{{citation |url=http://www.computerworlduk.com/community/blogs/index.cfm?entryid=2973 |title=WebM: Missing The Assurances Open Source Needs? |date=2010-05-24 |publisher=ComputerworldUK |first=Simon |last=Phipps}}</ref> In response, the WebM Project decoupled patents from copyright, offering the code under a standard [[BSD license]] and patents under a separate grant.<ref>{{citation |url=http://webmproject.blogspot.com/2010/06/changes-to-webm-open-source-license.html |title=Changes to the WebM Open Source License |date=2010-06-04 |first=Chris |last=DiBona |publisher=WebM}}</ref> The [[Free Software Foundation]], which maintains the [[Free Software Definition]], has given its endorsement for WebM and VP8<ref name="fsf">{{citation |url=http://www.fsf.org/news/free-software-foundation-statement-on-webm-and-vp8 |title=Free Software Foundation statement on WebM and VP8 |date=2010-05-19 |publisher=Free Software Foundation |first=Matt |last=Lee}}</ref> and considers the software's license to be compatible with the [[GNU General Public License]].<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.fsf.org/blogs/licensing/googles-updated-webm-license |title=Google's updated WebM license |publisher=Free Software Foundation|first=Brett |last=Smith |accessdate=2010-06-14}}</ref>
<ref name="gnu">{{Cite web |url=http://www.gnu.org/licenses/license-list.html#GPLCompatibleLicenses |title=Various Licenses and Comments about Them - GNU Project - Free Software Foundation (FSF) |publisher=Free Software Foundation |accessdate=2010-06-13}}</ref>
<ref name="gnu">{{Cite web |url=http://www.gnu.org/licenses/license-list.html#GPLCompatibleLicenses |title=Various Licenses and Comments about Them - GNU Project - Free Software Foundation (FSF) |publisher=Free Software Foundation |accessdate=2010-06-13}}</ref>
